questions.text: What is the minimum frequency for scheduled management reviews?

options.explanation: Monthly reviews are not required; the minimum is annually.
Quarterly reviews exceed the minimum requirement.
Per Section 5.1, management reviews are conducted at least annually, scheduled in Q1.
Every two years does not meet the minimum annual requirement.

questions.text: How far in advance must the agenda and input data be distributed before a management review?

options.explanation: One day does not allow adequate preparation time.
Per Section 5.4, agenda and input data are distributed at least 5 business days before the meeting.
Advance distribution is required to allow attendees to prepare.

questions.text: A management review can be triggered by a major nonconformance outside the annual schedule.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.1, reviews are also conducted after significant events including major nonconformances, regulatory findings, product recalls, or organizational changes.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a required management review input?

options.explanation: Audit results are a required input per Section 5.3.
Customer feedback is a required input per Section 5.3.
Individual performance reviews are not a management review input. The focus is on QMS processes, not individual performance.
CAPA status is a required input per Section 5.3.

questions.text: Within how many business days must meeting minutes be distributed after the review?

options.explanation: The requirement is 5 business days, not 1.
Per Section 5.6, meeting minutes are distributed within 5 business days.
10 days exceeds the requirement stated in the SOP.
